Fields.DialogueText: Coffee. The Captain requires coffee.
Good morning, Kanchou. I take it the rough seas weren't kind to you overnight?

Fields.MenuText: A cup of tea is exactly what I need!
What kind of tea?
I really want a cup of coffee.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, Kanchou. Gyokuro tea stimulates the senses!
Only the best green tea from Japan!
Too much coffee prevents sleep. I advise that you cut back.
I need to be alert. We have a lot to prepare for with the Imperial inspection upon us.
I agree, Kanchou. It is of the utmost importance that the ship be in immaculate condition. I have taken the liberty of asking Lieutenant Marks to supervise the effort.
I appreciate the initiative, Lady Naka, but cleanliness isn't our only concern. The inspectors will want a demonstration of our combat readiness.
Kanchou, you know how we fight - I'm confident our visitors will be satisfied. I'm much more worried about the state of the galley.
Point taken. Still, I'd like to see plans for weapon tests and combat drills as soon as possible. Let's not be complacent.
With pleasure, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
We have unwelcome visitors, Kanchou.
I'll meet you on the bridge.
@BATTLE
No, they were not. I don't usually have a problem sleeping through exciting weather, but...
Would you care to join me for a cup of tea?
On the double, Ensign! In an hour's time I want to be able to see my dazzling smile reflected on the deck!
You're really putting your heart into Naka's orders, I see.
One hundred percent, Captain! After all that Naka's done for us, the least we can do is make her look spiffy for her bosses.
Keep it up, Lieutenant - but don't forget your other duties. We can't afford to miss a radio transmission.
Yes, Captain! Officer Furuichi is currently manning– or should I say womanning, the radio while I maintain the crew.
Then who is on lookout?
She is, Captain.
And navigating?
She is, Captain.
Pulling triple duty?! That's the kind of recklessness that'll leave us open to a–
*ALARM*
Morgana attack...
Drop all cleaning procedures, and report to your battle stations immediately! Go, go, go!
To the bridge, Lieutenant!
Aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
Oh! Captain! I didn't see you there!
And, honestly, the fact that she put me in charge of this instead of one of the Japanese men... I know she's making a statement to her admirals, and I'm not gonna let her down.
What happened was nearly a disaster! The bridge was manned by only one officer!
I'm sorry, Kanchou! I thought I could handle it while Lieutenant Marks took over cleaning! We have a lot to take care of in a short period of time!
I understand that, but we can't neglect our main duties!
Kanchou is right! We need visual, navigation, and radio at all times.

Fields.MenuText: Where were you, Naka?
I'm at fault, too - I wasn't at the bridge either.
I hate to say it, but worrying about the inspection is a distraction. Things will settle down when it's done.

Fields.DialogueText: I...I was in my quarters, meditating.
You do have a way of taking on tasks other commanders might delegate, Kanchou.
I agree. But how are we going to manage until then?
From now on, Captain, I'll make sure that the cleaning crew reports to me on the bridge for further orders. That way, I won't miss anything!
And I will make sure that we have a location on all officers at all times. That way, in an emergency, we can leap into action!
As the spirit of this ship, I can sense where everyone is at all times, there is no need for that, Officer.
With all due respect, Lady Naka, I disagree.
Excuse me, Officer?
At the last battle, you were missing. You were the one we needed a location on. Your ability to sense didn't help us in that instant!
The officer is correct. Gomen'nasai.
Though I trust that Lady Naka will spring into action when she senses danger, I believe that Officer Furuichi's initiative will prove useful.
I'll have the system in place by the Imperial inspection. Who knows what calamity could befall us then!
Hopefully none.
My old man used to say "In theory, theory and practice are the same. In practice, they never are!"
*ALARM*
Don't they know I'm on the bridge?
Let's prove theory right, Lieutenant! Let's make this a textbook victory!
@BATTLE
Meditating again, Naka?
Hai. Finishing up. I... find myself more and more concerned that the ship isn't as ready for the inspection as we should be.
We drove off the Morganas with ease. What makes you say that?
The chain of command issue shouldn't have happened. Leaving the bridge to one officer shouldn't have happened.
That's my fault, Naka, not yours.
I fear that I will fail again, like my foresisters at the battle of Myeongnyang.

Fields.MenuText: Myeongnyang?
Foresisters?
Fail?

Fields.DialogueText: The legendary battle where Yi Sun-sin defeated 330 Japanese ships with only 13 of his own.
Over 300 years ago, 330 Japanese warships were defeated by 13 Joseon ships under control of Admiral Yi sun-sin. It is the gravest defeat in our Naval history.
I cannot let down my empire as did Hideyoshi's disastrous Naval failure against Yi Sun-sin, who felled 330 of our ships with only 13 of his own.
I fail to see how a small oversight on my behalf could lead to something as disastrous as the sinking of an entire fleet!
That is the danger, Kanchou! They failed to see that as well. They failed to see how Yi sun-sin used the currents of the strait to destroy a fleet!
They couldn't see it, because they believed defeat to be impossible, and so they were defeated.
I can't have my Belle on the verge of a nervous breakdown. Is there anything I can do to lift your spirit?
I need guidance.
Can I guide you?
Gomen'nasai. I mean no disrespect, Kanchou - but I need guidance from someone with greater experience. I... Kanchou, we're needed on the bridge!
Now she's not the only one on the verge of a nervous breakdown...
*ALARM*
Shell shock can wait, duty calls!
@BATTLE
Ahem! Lady Naka! I have a gift for you.
A gift? Kanchou, you did not have to get me anything!
I found biographies on Lord Admiral Nelson, Admiral Yi Sun-sin, as well as accounts of the Battle of Lepanto and the Battle of Salamis. I thought you might like to read them.
Dōmo arigatō gozaimasu! Thank you very much, Kanchou! I shall pore through every detail!
And I'm sure you've already visited the library, but I'm conspiring to improve the selection every time we visit a port. There may be more there that you haven't studied.
With your permission, Kanchou, I'd like to head to my quarters to review these volumes!
Dismissed!
You wanted to see me, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Speak quietly - she can hear you!
Maybe we should write down our answers, so she can't hear.
Wait until you hear the door close, and the book open...

Fields.DialogueText: Can't she hear everything?
Captain, that's a bit deceitful! Women don't like that!
Let me know when you're ready.
What word have you from Tokyo?
The Imperial inspection is still on schedule. The weather should be fair seas and warm temperatures.
And?
I hear that Prince Hiroyasu is sending some kind of "special representative." I don't know as much as I probably should about Imperial politics, but I assume that's a big deal.
That's what I feared. I know we'll be ready, though.
But what about Lady Naka?
I'll break the news to hear. In the meantime, let's hope she was paying more attention to those books than this conversation.
Very good, Captain. Shall I head back to the bridge?
*ALARM*
I think that answers your question. On the double!
Aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
Today is the big day! My ship is immaculate! I owe it all to you, Lieutenant Marks. Thank you for taking the time to make my hull shine.
Golly! I didn't expect you to be so emotional! Anything for the good of the ship!
I don't owe it all to the Lieutenant, Kanchou. I have you to thank as well. Those books really helped.
Naka, there's something we need to speak about.
It's nothing that can't wait until after the inspection, Kanchou! I am ready to dazzle–
Captain, Officer Furuichi is showing Dowager Princess Kitashirakawa around. But another guest has asked to...
Princess? There's a princess on board?!
What did you think "Imperial inspection" meant? Ma'am?
I thought it was a figure of speech!
How about a figure of state?

Fields.MenuText: Please take my hand, ma'am.
I'm at your service.
Naka, please help Fujiwara-sama!

Fields.DialogueText: What an officer! We need more of your breed, Kanchou!
That uniform suits you, Kanchou. Please show me around your ship.
Are you too good for an old lady, Kanchou?
So, Naka-san! We have heard a great deal about you "Belles," but this is the first time Her Highness and I have seen you in person! Is it true that you're actually the kami of the ship?
Hai, Fujiwara-sama! And may I say it's a great honor to have you and the Princess in my humble care!
You most certainly may. You're so humble for a spirit!
Naka, how about a demonstration of your firepower?
Hai! 140 mm, salute!
*BOOM*
Ehm, salute!
*ALARM*
The demonstration will have to continue at a later date. Lieutenant Marks, please make sure that the Princess and Lady Fujiwara are escorted to a secure location.
That's fine for Hime-sama, but I'm here to observe! Point me to your bridge, Kanchou!
Heh. Follow me, ma'am.
Oh, dear...
@BATTLE
I'm Sachiko Fujiwara - I have the honor of accompanying Her Highness. Or stumbling after her, as the case may be.
With powers beyond mortal ken and such?
Ah. Our other guest, I assume? We met briefly when you came on board, but...
But it wasn't my place to occupy your time then. I... would you please lend me a hand? I don't have my sea legs yet.
Of course.
Follow? I'll be clinging onto you the whole way.
Attention, crew, the Morganas are onto us! Prepare for combat!
@BATTLE
Morgana reinforcements in full retreat, Kanchou! I think this fight is over.
My guns are ready to fire whenever, Kanchou! Let me send them a parting shot!
Marks, Furuichi, head to the deck and assess any damage.
Aye, Kanchou.
That was most magnificent, Kanchou! You and your crew certainly handle yourselves magnificently under pressure - the Princess will be very pleased.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you, ma'am. We all work very hard around here!
Thanks. It's nice to see at least some of my training stuck.
Thank you - but I couldn't have done it without Lady Naka.

Fields.DialogueText: Still, it is the Kanchou who commands the crew. My congratulations!
Perhaps you could train the next generation of officers once you've finished fighting the Morganas.
Naka, you are a magnificent war machine. I am glad to have seen you in battle!
Those Morganas are ferocious! Demon ships if I've ever seen one. What have you done to prepare for them?
Fujiwara-sama, Kanchou has given me many volumes of Naval history to read over to supplement our battle experience.
Fascinating! Who are you reading about now?
Yi Sun-shin...
Ah, the Empire's greatest defeat. In our family, it is said that we didn't have the blessing of the great Kami Ryūjin on our side.
The Ocean God?
The one and the same. Now, if you will excuse me, I must return to Hime-sama to give my report.
Hai...
You passed.
A... arigatō gozaimashita!
A less generous observer might note that your nervousness has been surprisingly obvious. I should think, as a rule, that a figure of authority owes her sailors a less... fragile comportment.
Ah! Mōshiwake arimasen!
Oh! Before I leave, let me leave you with this. It's a copy of a scroll from the Imperial library - a gift from Hime-sama. It may come in handy.
Arigatō gozaimashita!
Fair seas, Kanchou!
Kanchou! I apologize for entering unannounced! Sumimasen!

Fields.MenuText: That's quite all right, Naka. I imagine you have an important reason.
No need to apologize, but please don't make a habit of it!
Naka! I was about to take a bath!

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. You know I wouldn't do anything like this if it were unimportant.
Hai! I only make habits of things I enjoy.
Agh! I'll turn around until you're decent!
Please, Lady Naka, what is so urgent?
First, I want to apologize for my poor showing during the inspection. Mrs. Fujiwara was right! I have to get these nerves under control!
You redeemed yourself! Our battle with the Morganas proved our resolve!
More importantly, Kanchou, was something the lady said. She said that the blessing of the great kami Ryūjin wasn't given during our defeat by Yi Sun-shin.
She said it was a family tale. A folk tale, more or less.
Kanchou, I am a kami! As a class of beings, we clearly exist! If we can get the blessing of the great kami Ryūjin, I will be fearless!

Fields.MenuText: You interrupted me to talk about mystical nonsense?
How do we find this great kami?
I'm going to need a glass of rice beer first...

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! I am shocked at your disrespect. Am I mystical nonsense?
I have a detailed plan that I'd like to share with you ASAP.
I'll have one brought up from the mess hall immediately!
*ALARM*
Bring me up to speed on our way to the bridge, Naka. Let's get moving on this as soon as we route those Morganas!
@BATTLE
This is so exciting! We're going to meet an ocean god!
I'm a little confused on the details. Can you go over the plan again, Naka?
It's simple. We head for Kagoshima, get as close as we can to the Ryugu Shrine...
And Ryūjin will bless Naka and then we will never have to fear another Morgana attack! It's so simple, Marks!
Ahaha, yes, so simple. I merely wanted to make sure everyone else understood it...
Right, because you definitely didn't say you were confused.
THIS IS MY FIRST TIME SUMMONING SPIRITS AND GODS! Give me a break.

Fields.MenuText: Lieutenant, do you need some air?
Come now, Lieutenant - this isn't rocket science.
In all fairness, I'm pretty confused as well.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm okay, Captain. I promise.
It sure isn't radio communications either!
So I'm not the only one! Ha!
I understand this might be a fools' errand, but I feel compelled to maximize our chances of victory!
I agree! We must help Naka get her confidence back– err– maximize her chances of victory!
Hold that thought. We have a transmission incoming.
And at least the Ryugu shrine isn't too far out of the way. We're en route to Okinawa anyway, and...
Sorry, folks. New orders.
Iyada!
The Morganas are apparently putting a lot of pressure on the Aleutian Islands. We've been directed to head north and direct the effort to discourage them from base-building.
Then all is lost. I should be put in dry dock.
No time for moping, Miss Naka! We have Morganas abaft!
Snap out of it, Naka! Engage!
@BATTLE
Which is... dedicated to this dragon god guy? No disrespect intended.
To Ryūjin, hai.
A temple priest has agreed to come out here and talk to us. It's my hope that together we'll devise a ceremony that will allow me to appeal to Ryūjin, kami to kami.
Um...
Pardon me, Lieutenant. Please continue.
Mā, Naka seems really depressed lately. Not even defeating the Morganas is lifting her spirits.
Maybe we should invite her to the dance at the officers' mess! That could lift her spirits. Speaking of which, I was wondering if you –
Dancing isn't going to help anything! She needs guidance from the spirit realm! Think, Marks, think!
I was thinking! I spent hours thinking about that dance...
What do you think, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: I think Lieutenant Marks wanted to ask you something.
Can we wing a Shinto ritual on our own?
Some Japanese ships are already being treated as shrines themselves, for obvious reasons. We could put in a request for a permanent Shinto priest or shrine maider.

Fields.DialogueText: We already discussed his idea! Kanchou, we need that shrine!
It's not something to do lightly, Kanchou.
Well, yes. But it requires special training and accreditation from the Ministry of the Navy. It would be months, I'm sure.
I mean, ultimately, we have our mission. We are where we are and we have the resources we have. We're not going to be patrolling at will around southern Japan in the near future.
Ryujin...
It's not the same, but... my grandmother told me when she died, she'd come visit me in her garden, so that's where I'd go to talk with her, instead of her grave.
My... dog died, a while back. So, if you need to talk to somebody, you can count on me.
Not now, Marks.
Hm. I think we would still want circumstances that would be meaningful to Ryūjin, though. A place and a time with symbolic meaning.
*ALARM*
Kanchou, may I plot a course of evasive action? Morganas on the portside!
Full steam ahead!
@BATTLE
Ryūjin.
Yeah, him. He's an ocean god, right? I mean, it's the same ocean. Does Naka really need to go to one particular shrine?
Listen, Naka was interested in Ryugu for the expertise of the priests as well as for the traditional connections to Ryūjin and Otohime and whatnot.
But she does believe that she's the same kind of being as Ryūjin, so maybe we can make the case to her that human intercession isn't essential. She's already her own priestess, in a sense.
What are you proposing, Kanchou?
I honestly don't know. How does one supernatural being reach out to another? A tea ceremony may be just as appropriate as anything you'd see at a conventional shrine.
We've gotten a go ahead from the Asakaze, Kanchou. Moving to rendezvous.
Kanchou? Are we going to be joining with a destroyer squadron for the next mission?
Not exactly. I'm afraid we might have to make a detour to ensure the security of our ship, and I'm hoping to talk to an expert.
Are you pulling me out of combat operations?! I apologize for my exaggerations previously. You of all people should know I would never let my emotions jeopardize the well-being of my crew!
*giggles*
What's so funny?
Nothing, Lady Naka. I've never seen you so emotional, that's all. Perhaps you need a cup of tea.
... A cup of tea would do wonders to calm my nerves. Shall I bring one for everyone?
That sounds lovely.
I'll be glad to...as soon as you tell me why we are rendezvousing with the Asakaze!
Are you holding my tea hostage?
Kanchou, our friendship depends upon no secrets!
I'm sorry to interrupt - but we have Funayūrei approaching from the north!
Sound the alarm. And, Naka, we're off to find somebody to talk to about Ryūjin. I don't know what to expect, but since we're all up north anyway it's not exactly a huge inconvenience.
Kanchou, you really didn't have to.
Yeah, well. I like it when my ship owes me a favor.
@BATTLE
Did you take the chance to visit Asakaze, Lieutenant?
Nah. I mean, it was nice of them to invite officers over, but... I mean, she's a destroyer. It's not like she's the Taj Mahal.
Don't disrespect her! She may not have a Belle to challenge you, but her pride still stands strong.
Oh, I didn't mean any disrespect. But I've served on destroyers, so it's not like I don't know...
BAKA!
What? Me?
Ah, Naka-sama. It's an honor beyond measure to meet you, and a pleasure I can hardly describe to be invited aboard this ship.
Hahaha! Marks shouldn't have left. They share the same sense of humor.
Kanchou! Permission to board?

Fields.MenuText: Don't get all formal on me. You're doing us a favor.
Permission granted - but wipe your feet!
Granted. Welcome aboard.

Fields.DialogueText: HA! You're inviting an old man to ramble on about his subject of expertise and you think he's doing you the favor?
HAHAHA! Worried about mud, Kanchou?
Ojamashimasu!
Heh. Thanks again for coming.
So. You know I was an academic in civilian life, yes? Not a priest, not a monk.
But Ryūjin worship was something of a passion of yours, correct? Or Ryūjin tradition?
Hai. Some people collect stamps - I collected old stories and odd little folk tales about Ōwatatsumi-kami.
*ALARM*
Ah the blood of the seas boils! A battle is on the horizon! May I join from the bridge? I've waited my whole life to see a sea goddess fight up close! HAHAHA!
Ask the ship!
It would be a pleasure, Lieutenant-Commander.
For the Empire of the Sun!
@BATTLE
This would be a good time to stop talking, Lieutenant. In fact, report back to the bridge and let the Asakaze know the Lieutenant-Commander has safely arrived.
Yes, Captain.
Lieutenant-Commander Iwanami. Yōkoso.
Not least because you've probably got a better cook in your galley than we do! HA!
There they are! Ready the cannons, we are going to make them pay!
@BATTLE
Excellent tactics, Kanchou! Though I believe you missed an opportunity to cross the Morganas' "T" about one third of the way through.
Aaah! You're quite the expert, Lieutenant-Commander!
HA! I'm an old fool who's read a lot of naval theory, that's all!
You know how we defeated the Russians at Tsushima?
Tell us.
We knew the Russians kept low-grade coal in the open right below deck. We used this knowledge to concentrate our fire in a way to cause maximum damage.
That's what we need here! That's what we have to concentrate on to win!
Hai! If you know the enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles!
Are you getting all this? If not, don't worry - I have a whole book full of my prattling for you! HAHAHA!
Arigatōgozaimashita. Your expertise is invaluable. However, I have to ask... what of Ryūjin?
The Ocean Kami is a mysterious beast.
Do you know where we can go to reach out to him?
You seek his blessing?
Wouldn't you? If you were me?
I'm sorry. That was presumptuous.
Oh, don't be absurd. I just don't know the answer. I suppose in some sense Ōwatatsumi-kami is your father, and it's only right that you pay your filial respects.
But...?
But I think you're already paying respect by exercising intelligence and hard work, like all the rest of us. These monsters have brought the war to his home, after all.
Hai. The sea feels soaked in blood.
I'll tell you, what bothers me most about this war is how little we actually know about the enemy.
Their nature, you mean? How kami could be so... corrupted? And how they might be cured?
Oh, Naka-sama, that's too much for a simple man like me. I'd settle for the basics.
Dictate the terms of the battle! Ensure you have accurate intelligence! And, importantly, let the enemy believe you are set do to the opposite of what you are planning!
You want to seek out Ryūgū-jō, his great undersea palace, and speak to him directly, then?
Is it possible?
Oh, for the likes of me, there's no doubt.  But you?
What can we do to gain the Ocean Kami's blessing?
Oh, Naka-sama. If only I knew...
If you can locate his shrine, and purify it with an offering fit for a kami, perhaps he will respond in kind.
Hai! Magnificent! I will do whatever it takes to ensure that we honor the great Ryūjin!
Your kanchou thought that would be your response. I brought notes, everything I can remember. I should warn you, they're... idiosyncratic.
Arigatō gozaimashita! We'll get right on finding it.
Yes, yes. But don't neglect the war, Kanchou! You have a duty to humanity as well.

Fields.MenuText: I have a duty to my Belle first and foremost.
Thank you, sir. I will never forget my place.

Fields.DialogueText: That is a powerful friendship!
It would be impossible for you to do so.
Thank you for your hospitality. I must return to the Asakaze - if I stay away too long they might try to fob this old fool off on you! HAHAHA!
Wasn't he incredible, Kanchou? What an inspiration.
*ALARM*
Let's put some of his teachings to the test! To the bridge!
@BATTLE
But, listen, I've heard stories in Hokkaido. They say there was once a temple to Ōwatatsumi-kami, far to the north. Lost now for centuries.
Thank you from me, too.
Should I ask?
I just... have an unusual system for remembering things. You'll see.
Here are the documents that Iwanami gave us. See if you can make any sense of them!
I'm sorry you were banished, Marks! He was so funny!
I wasn't banished. I'm just even funnier than he is, and didn't want him to have to compete.
Let's see... Are these all in Japanese?
Oh. Yeah.
Perhaps I can help? I wouldn't want you two working solely on my account. Let's see...hmm. Hm...

Fields.MenuText: Is it written in code?
Poor handwriting?
Don't leave us in the dark!

Fields.DialogueText: No, but it is buried in poetry.
Thankfully, no. It's thick with verse however.
All the clues are hidden inside his poetry!
I love poetry! I wish someone would write me a sonnet.
The Earth rips apart/ then belches forth hot new land/ overtakes the old.
That's easy! A volcano! So the shrine has been melted?
It trails off from there. Clearly, there is something about a volcano, and an earthquake. This is impossible! And the paper is ripped!
Not to interrupt your concentration, folks, but...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Uh-huh.
Can I help?
Well, I...
Not right now, though.
Gotcha. Lady Naka, what have we got?
"What potions have I drunk of sirens' tears, distilled as limbecks foul as hell within?"
Practicing your Shakespeare, Lieutenant?
Ah! Captain! I didn't see you there! I was reciting the classics!
I think I might have some Ryūjin-related information. You remember that Mrs. Fujiwara and the Imperial Princess left us a scroll?
Ah, and you think that combined with our shouty friend's materials, we might be able to locate the shrine? Excellent! So what are we waiting for?

Fields.MenuText: I'm afraid of getting Naka's hopes up.
I want it to be a surprise.
I wanted to know your thoughts first.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand, but you know how she hates secrets.
We all know how that one worked out last time.
My thoughts are that we go straight to Naka!
... You're right.
Shall we head for the bridge?
*ALARM*
I believe that answers that question. Oh - and, Lieutenant, when reciting poetry to a woman, don't lead with "foul as hell within."
Uh, aye, Captain...
@BATTLE
Well, it seems it wasn't a coincidence that Mrs. Fujiwara had the great kami of the sea on her mind.
But, honestly, I don't know how this plays out. I was looking for a way to get Naka over her bout of self-doubt. Going on a mad hunt for a temple nobody's seen in hundreds of years...
If it ever existed at all.
Exactly. We can keep it up for a while, as long as it doesn't interfere with our duties, but...
Oh, well. One day at a time.
Hmmm....
Is that a good "hmmm?"
Was the scroll of any use?
It's a book of prayer along with a list of major shrines for individual kami.
What does it say about Ryūjin?
Actually, Kanchou, it may not be the scroll itself that's of interest here. There are several pages of commentary attached, and I recognize the handwriting...
... You're going to say it's that guy who called me an idiot, aren't you?
He's certainly an expert in the field.
Hai. And these are different poems than the ones we've been reading recently.
This is older, obviously. The question is whether he forgot something useful or if this is all redundant or just out of date.
Well, let's just check it out!
Where water meets steam/ Ryūjin sleeps under the sea/  Sail north from Abashiri/ One day for each of his jewels.
Ryūjin had three lucky jewels that were supposedly stolen by an Empress. That's three days.
Checking the maps, ma'am! Hang on...

Fields.MenuText: Full steam ahead!
Any Morganas in our path?
Let's radio the fleet first.

Fields.DialogueText: Uh oh! Morgana fleet engaging!
Speak of the devil, here they come!
Radio for backup, demon warships dead ahead!
@BATTLE
We've got to be looking at Sakhalin, right? Or, if it's not due north, one of the Kuril Islands?
Karafuto, surely.
Listen, it's not on the modern maps, but I've got a copy of a seventeenth century Dutch map that shows a small island off the east coast of Sakhalin.
It's probably nothing, but... well, it might be as good a place as any to start.
I've always loved your insane optimism.
Hush, you. Kanchou? What do you think?
It's not exactly close to Attu Station, but I suppose the Soviets wouldn't object if we asked to expand the scope of our sweep...
Kanchou! Ohayō!
Hi, Naka. Happy with the shrine hunt so far?
About that... we still are missing a key piece of the puzzle: how to purify the shrine.
I almost forgot. Could we perhaps have a priest bless the area? Would an offering suffice?
These tomes suggest we need imperial blood. The "jewels" that were stolen must be replaced with three drops of blood.
Well, that's not going to happen.
... Hai.
I can't believe I'm saying this, but - how about your blood? A blessing from one kami to another?
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: I'll give it my all if you promise me the same!
Remember - you need to come out of this fight with some blood left in you!

Fields.DialogueText: The Funayūrei will fall under our coordinated attack!
I will ensure we emerge without a scratch.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, that's...

Fields.MenuText: Brilliant?
Ridiculous?
Beneath us both?

Fields.DialogueText: Let's just go with "worth a try."
Here we go again.
Captain? I cleared our travel plans with the Soviets and with Tokyo, and... well, there's been a complication.
I hate that sentence.
Prepared for anything, Kanchou! Even a surprise inspection, if it comes to that!
That's what I like to hear!
Oh, I know I'm going to be a bother. But if you're collecting blood for the kami, I'm prepared to donate.
Hello there, ma'am! Lieutenant Marks at your service!
So kind! Help me with my bags.
Eager young man. It really speaks well of navy discipline.
We'll be laying in the course as soon as we've eliminated the last of the Funayūrei in the area. It shouldn't be long at all.
You've changed since last we met. It's good. I like your spirit!
Thank you for your gift, by the way. It made this little expedition possible.
*ALARM*
Looks like those Funayūrei are hungry for battle. Better give them hell!
@BATTLE
No, it's okay. I think. Mrs. Fujiwara has asked for permission to join us.
Well, I...
And she's on a vessel that's going to rendezvous with us almost immediately. Apparently.
... It seems she knew we would say yes. Okay with you, Naka?
I'm going to have to have a long talk with our lookouts, I see.
But, that said, welcome aboard, Lady Fujiwara.
I don't think that will be necessary, Fujiwara-sama.
So, I understand we have a destination in mind?
Well, I had a good feeling about it.
How many more waves can there be?!
Sorry, Kanchou. The ocean just insists on making more.
Let them come! My hull has never felt stronger!
I have never felt more tired!
Kanchou! We have no time for nerves or fatigue. You must command the ship.

Fields.MenuText: We lift each other up when we're feeling down. Thank you!
How could I fight without you by my side?

Fields.DialogueText: That is the power of trust we have built, Kanchou!
Poorly, Kanchou!
Here comes yet another wave!
@BATTLE
Well done, Kanchou. Have you been reading the teachings of Nelson?
Those of Themostocles, Naka. The great Greek tactician!
Between the two of us, our knowledge shall overcome any Funayūrei.
And our experience in battle is only getting stronger.
Here they come again. Let's meet them head on!
Engage!
I think that I'm going to offer some fried salmon to Ryūjin as well. I want to give back my favorite food, seeing as all fish live within his borders.

Fields.MenuText: I'll offer one of my books. Hopefully Ryūjin will appreciate the knowledge.
I'll offer one of our ship's ceremonial swords. Ryūjin will honor our strength.
You don't think that's an argument for offering chicken?

Fields.DialogueText: Without those books, Kanchou, how can we pass our knowledge on?
That is such a traditional sacrifice, Kanchou. I know we will honor him.
You raise a valid point... but this feels right.
Are we talking about what we'll offer? I'm going to offer my favorite jazz record! I hope it doesn't sound weird underwater.
I don't know what I should give?
I know! Why don't you recite your poem? You're always talking about how fantastic it is, and how you want me to hear it.
Oh, boy.
He's so shy!
Where's our guest?
Resting in her quarters, Kanchou. Shall I wake her?
Negative. There's no need for her on the bridge, and if she can sleep she might as well save her strength.
If *I* can sleep, can I save my strength?
When you're attached to the Imperial household, you can do whatever you want.
Maybe you should marry her!
When did it become "gang up on Marks Day?"
When you decided to complain about your job.
*ALARM*
Why does that keep happening? I'm right here!
Speaking of complaining!
Exactly as Yi Sun-sin would do! Let's crush the enemy! Ikimashō!
Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Tell me, Lieutenant - why did you sign up for the war?
I did it to save humanity, ma'am.
Excellent! Now, why did you really sign up for the war?
... Because my father served in the Great War, and I wanted to follow in his footsteps.
Did he return from the Great War?
Minus an arm and an eye. Sometimes, I'm afraid that I'll not return at all. Or worse, I won't return myself. I've seen some horrors, ma'am.
War is hell - don't you agree, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: How did you know I was here?
I would go for hell to save the ones I love!
It definitely isn't heaven.

Fields.DialogueText: The Imperial family is descended from the gods. There are benefits to that.
It is one thing to say that. It's another to do it.
That's putting it mildly.
I'm scared of losing the ones I care about. Not just at home, but...
Maybe you should tell her as much.
Is it that obvious?
If you weren't such a fine officer, I'd have you written up for breaking the Uniform Code of Military Justice by now.
I can't help it! She's some kind of wonderful.
We're at war here. Don't let it affect your performance, and I'll look the other way. We have bigger fish to fry.
Speaking of fish, I am quite hungry. Is it time for dinner yet?
*ALARM*
Always interrupting right before dinner. It's like these things want to fight us angry.
@BATTLE
The fog is growing thicker the closer we get to the volcano.
I can't imagine that you enjoy that. Fog, smoke, fire, lava.
Please don't remind me; I'm trying to forget it.
Will you be able to make it?
The promise of what lies ahead is too great to turn back.
You do realize there could be nothing there, right?
Hai. But just doing what we set out to do is important to me, too.

Fields.MenuText: Would you care to join me for a cup of tea?
Perhaps we should relax with some meditation before we arrive.
I found a new book on the Battle of the Jutland, would you like to look it over with me?

Fields.DialogueText: A cup of tea on the bridge would do wonders to calm my nerves.
Meditation will focus our minds on the task at hand. Let's commence.
The greatest stalemate of the Great War? Sure, let's learn what to avoid doing.
@BATTLE
Fair enough. The Soviet and Japanese governments are happy we're thinning the Morgana presence out here, too, so everybody wins.
The smoke is getting really bad! Are we there yet?
By my calculations - yes, we are!
Hai. I think that's appropriate, Kanchou. We've all cleansed ourselves and made what preparations we could. Who is up first?
I'll go. I have...
The sense of fear that drives me still, to fight against the ships of ill. To you, my love, I'll sail eternally, To serve and protect my officer Furuichi—uh, Ryūjin..."
Officer... Ryūjin?
It's all I could come up with on short notice! I... have to go check the radio now.
Sail eternally... Marks, wait!!!
I hope Ryūjin will understand. What a dramatic moment!
For my part, I offer a...  well, a simple woodcarving made by my father in his days at sea. I pray the great kami will not be offended.
Naka?
I offer three drops of blood, to take the place of thy three stolen jewels.
I'll just take that knife now.
Is anything happening?
Is that...a ship?
Ryūjin's ship?
... Funayūrei. Fujiwara-sama, take cover!
@BATTLE
Okay, I don't see any surviving physical structure on land. If everyone agrees, and if we're confident in our detective work, I declare this patch of water auspicious and favored by the sea kami.
We bow first.
Oh. Right.
Okay. I have prepared a poem... for an offering. "The tides of war rock fast my heart, beating waves of love that rip apart.
He didn't bow and clap at the end, either.
Here they come again! Get to stations, people!
@BATTLE
Are they gone?
Hai. It appears so.
You know we've done what we set out to do, right?
Kanchou?
I can't think of a better way to cleanse a sea temple than to drive away the Funayūrei. This wasn't a battle so much as an exorcism.
I think your Kanchou may be on to something, Naka-kami.
It has been known to happen.
Upon this whole ship, I'd say, the blessing of Ryūjin has been earned.
It's kind of you to say, but I'm not sure. The actual ceremony was a bit of a disaster.
Let me say something scandalous: the blessing of Ryūjin is not something given for following a formula. It is earned through study, through practice, through war, through camaraderie!
You are only as strong as you make yourself! And you have made yourself ironclad!
Agreed. Thank you, Mrs. Fujiwara.
What? I just stood here in your way while you all defeated the enemy. That hardly requires thanks!
That was incredible! We helped out a spirit and a God! No one back home will believe this! How the tides of war rock fast my heart!
You liked it, then?
How could I not! You're a warrior poet, and I'm the muse! I can't wait for more.
More!?!
Kidding! One is good enough, for now. See you at the Officers' Mess Dance?
Ma'am yes ma'am!
Hehe, dismissed!
All's well that ends well.

Fields.MenuText: I'm extremely proud of you, Naka.
Our teamwork makes us invincible.
Our friendship saved the day!

Fields.DialogueText: As am I of you, Kanchou. I've never had a truer friend. Thank you.
No ship shall ever vanquish the power of our knowledge and experience!
You are a great friend, Kanchou. Let us set out to save humanity!
Light Cruiser Naka: SALUTE!
HYAAAA!

Fields.MenuText: *nods*
I'm sorry. Maybe no one told you, but I'm the one who gives inspirational speeches around here.
Note to self: invite more old ladies on board to improve morale.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! You're a cheeky one, aren't you?
A... Arigatō gozaimashita!
I do, however, think I deserve tea.
Ha! Just follow that ensign.
